subject: Re: [junit] Question about creating a fixture for JUnitPerf

messageBody:
Mike Foley wrote:

> I have some JUnit/Cactus tests that I am converting to JUnitPerf timed
> and load tests. The JUnit test deploys and undeploys in setUp() and
> tearDown(). For the JUnitPerf tests I only want setUp() to occur for
> the first user first iteration....and for tearDown() I only want to
> undeploy for last user last iteration. How best to accomplish this?

I assume you want this behavior:

1. Set up
2. Run all tests
3. Tear down

For this, you want TestSetup. Subclass TestSetup to do your one-time set
up and tear down, then create a class like this:

class TimedTestsWithOneTimeSetUp {
public static Test suite() {
return new OneTimeSetup(new TestSuite(MyTimedTests.class));
}
}

I'm not sure whether this will give you the performance measurements you
want, because it will exclude the one-time setup/tear down from those
measurements, but it will work.
